question: The government body that administers amateur radio in Australia is?
c: The Australian Communications and Media Authority
answerSummary: The Australian Communications and Media authority (ACMA) administers all communications in australia, including Amateur Radio.

An amateur radio operator is approached to transmit message on behalf of a friend to another operator. The friend offers a few dollars to get the message through quickly. Should the operator send the message?
A radio operator has received an electric shock and is lying on the floor. You should first -
b: Call PAN PAN, if no reply call MAYDAY.
c: Call the electricity company then dial 000.
d: Ensure you are not in danger then turn off the power

question: If cables are run across the floor of the station, it may cause -
c: A hum in the signal from mains power induction

If a lightning storm is expected, you should consider –
a: Leaving the station until the storm passes
c: Install a large capacitor to the antenna input
d: Connect the station to battery power only

question: If your station is causing harmful interference to a radio service, you must –
One of the purposes of the Amateur Service is –
b: To reduce congestion on the internet
c: To provide an alternative to mobile telephone services

a: Erect a wire fence to block radio signals
b: Ask the neighbor to install radio filtering devices
c: Call the local council electrical inspector for advice
d: Site your antennas as far as possible from any equipment that may be affected

The selectivity of a receiver refers to –
a: The ability to select a wide range of bands
b: The ability to reject unwanted frequencies
c: The ability of the squelch control to limit background noise
d: The ability to control the treble and bass of the audio output

A call over radio involving safety of life is referred to as:
An urgent situation not involving the safety of life is called:
A radio amateur should announce their callsign:
b: at the beginning of the first transmission and then at least every 10 minutes
c: at the beginning and end of every transmission
d: at the beginning and end of a series of transmissions

question: A foundation licensee can allow an unqualified person to operate their station
a: if the foundation licensee is present at all times
b: if the foundation licensee announces his callsign
c: if the other person says “second operator” after the callsign
d: a Foundation operator cannot supervise an unlicensed person

question: An amateur radio licence authorises the holder to communicate with:
a: other amateur radio operators and CB radio operators
c: any two-way radio services on HF (3-30 MHz)

question: An amateur radio operator must produce their evidence of qualification if requested to do so by:
a: a Wireless Institute of Australia inspector
b: a Wireless Institute of Australia assesso
d: a Federal or State police officer

question: Which of the following are basic SI units of electricity:
The acronyms FM and AM as used in radio stand for:
d: Fine Modulation (High fidelity) and Angular Modulation

question: A radio receiver that can pick up weak signals is said to be:
When operating on amateur radio bands it is the operators responsibility to ensure that their transmissions:
b: are at least 3KHz from the band edges
c: are within a distance from the band edges as determined by the ACMA
d: are equal to or less then 0dBm outside the amateur band

a: the immunity of household appliances to power line interference
b: the ability of household appliances to reject noise
c: the ability of household appliances to reject radio frequencies
d: the requirement for household equipment to comply with Australian Standards

question: The acronym EMC stands for:
An incorrectly adjusted antenna tuner may cause:
a: interference to non amateur radio services
d: polarisation of the radiated signal to change

question: Amateur radio, TV and Broadcast radio can suffer interference from:
During a thunderstorm an amateur station should:
b: be tuned to the international weather warning frequency
c: increase power to overcome lightning static

question: Antenna erection and rigging should be carried out:
a: by persons with a Amateur Radio Riggers Certificate II or higher
b: by persons with the necessary skills and safety equipment
c: by persons with a Standard licence or higher
d: when three or more people are present one of whom must know CPR

question: Cells and batteries contain chemicals that:
a: are the same as those used in capacitors
b: can burn the skin and corrode metals
c: give off explosive helium gas when they are charged

question: Antennas and their fittings should:
a: be higher than 5 metres at the lowest point
b: be made from non conductive materials
c: be kept well away from power lines
d: never cross buildings inhabited by people

question: Power measurements of a Foundation Operators transmitter:
a: must be made with a suitably calibrated power measuring device
b: may be calculated by the voltage and current of the power supply
c: can only be performed by a Standard or Advanced operator
d: must be conducted at the nominal temperature of twenty degrees Celsius
